The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#10102](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10102) (Multiprocess bitcoin by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Updated 1d96788ce97f3dcfbe326652c0d6204624dbb783 -> 347774b86c8e451300c9487d8c350ebdb0df2f86 ([pr23345.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr23345.01) -> [pr23345.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr23345.02), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr23345.01..pr23345.02)):

- addressed @luke-jr's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23345#pullrequestreview-793266469):

> Doesn't this also need configure changes to allow building it without unnecessary deps?

- addressed @laanwj's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23345#discussion_r746860579)

diff_hunk:
@@ -1336,6 +1336,15 @@ if test x$use_ebpf != xno; then
   )
 fi
 
+build_leveldb=yes
+if test x$build_bitcoin_cli$build_bitcoin_tx$build_bitcoin_util$build_bitcoind$bitcoin_enable_qt$use_bench$use_tests = xnonononononono; then
body: I guess we should only be checking bitcoind/bitcoin-qt here (the other tools don't need them either?), but perhaps that's safer left for a later PR...

diff_hunk:
@@ -1336,6 +1336,15 @@ if test x$use_ebpf != xno; then
   )
 fi
 
+build_leveldb=yes
+if test x$build_bitcoin_cli$build_bitcoin_tx$build_bitcoin_util$build_bitcoind$bitcoin_enable_qt$use_bench$use_tests = xnonononononono; then

@@ -841,8 +852,11 @@ nodist_libbitcoin_ipc_a_SOURCES = $(libbitcoin_ipc_mpgen_output)
 CLEANFILES += $(libbitcoin_ipc_mpgen_output)
 endif
 
+if BUILD_LEVELDB
 include Makefile.crc32c.include
body: I don't understand why an explicit conditional is needed here. Shouldn't `make` be able to figure out for itself whether these libraries need to be built?

diff_hunk:
@@ -841,8 +852,11 @@ nodist_libbitcoin_ipc_a_SOURCES = $(libbitcoin_ipc_mpgen_output)
 CLEANFILES += $(libbitcoin_ipc_mpgen_output)
 endif
 
+if BUILD_LEVELDB
 include Makefile.crc32c.include
body:
> Shouldn't `make` be able to figure out for itself whether these libraries need to be built?

Yes, it should.

> I don't understand why an explicit conditional is needed here.

It is not _needed_. It's an optimization -- not processing unused `Makefile.*.include` files.

diff_hunk:
@@ -841,8 +852,11 @@ nodist_libbitcoin_ipc_a_SOURCES = $(libbitcoin_ipc_mpgen_output)
 CLEANFILES += $(libbitcoin_ipc_mpgen_output)
 endif
 
+if BUILD_LEVELDB
 include Makefile.crc32c.include

@@ -841,8 +852,11 @@ nodist_libbitcoin_ipc_a_SOURCES = $(libbitcoin_ipc_mpgen_output)
 CLEANFILES += $(libbitcoin_ipc_mpgen_output)
 endif
 
+if BUILD_LEVELDB
 include Makefile.crc32c.include
body: Thanks. Yes, I don't think this was worth special-case optimizing, parsing performance of `make` is hardly an issue on modern systems afaik.
